text:
“Did you know they experiment on the insane in Paris?” 

Raskolnikov barely listened. 

Lebeziatnikov continued, “One professor believed insanity is just a logical mistake.” 

Raskolnikov nodded and entered his house. 

He stood in his small room, confused. 

Why had he returned? 

Dust covered everything. 

A loud knocking echoed from the yard. 

He tiptoed to the window, peering out. 

Nothing but emptiness greeted him. 

Sickly geraniums drooped in the neighboring windows. 

He turned away and sank onto the sofa.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on the idea that insanity may stem from a logical error rather than a physical ailment, while feeling disconnected and absorbed in his own thoughts.
